author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet all of the guidelines for automatic merging.

Specifically, your pull request does not meet the following guidelines:

- Name does not meet all of the following: starts with a capital letter, ASCII alphanumerics only, ends in lowercase
- Name is not at least five characters long

---
It is important to note that if your pull request does not meet the guidelines for automatic merging, this does not mean that your pull request will never be merged. It just means that your pull request will require manual review by a human.

> These guidelines are intended not as requirements for packages but as very conservative guidelines, which, if your new package or new version of a package meets them, it may be automatically merged.

---
On a separate note, I see that you are registering a release with a version number of the form `v0.X.Y`.

Does your package have a stable public API? If so, then it's time for you to register version `v1.0.0` of your package. (This is not a requirement. It's just a recommendation.)

If your package does not yet have a stable public API, then of course you are not yet ready to release version `v1.0.0`.

---
[noblock]
How about naming this EntityComponentSystem? Just a suggestion for a more descriptive name.

Yea I thought about that too, but it's so long. I'm not 100% pro not 100%
against. You think it's really better? Maybe it's more Julian though I'm
not sure.

On Mon, Oct 28, 2019 at 10:32 AM Fredrik Ekre <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> How about naming this EntityComponentSystem? Just a suggestion for a more
> descriptive name.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/4556?email_source=notifications&email_token=AFCD32NSHKRMBRC4XGR3RPTQQ2WRVA5CNFSM4JCVRYM2YY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFVREXG43VMVBW63LNMVXHJKTDN5WW2ZLOORPWSZGOECMHZRY#issuecomment-546864327>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AFCD32OA7EAVK5FIWIDF2MDQQ2WRVANCNFSM4JCVRYMQ>
> .
>

It was just a suggestion since ECS doesn't seem to be such a well-known acronym. Serching for it leads to `Esports Championship Series` or `Amazon Elastic Container Service`. I mostly wondered if you had thought of alternative names. If you want to keep the current one, then that is fine.

Hmm yea, in the gamedev world I think it's pretty well recognized. But
since I'm not really intending to have it focused on that for obvious
reasons, maybe it makes sense to change the name to something more
descriptive. I'll wait a little more for other answers on my quick question
in Slack, but yea I'm leaning more towards your suggestion.

On Mon, Oct 28, 2019 at 12:46 PM Fredrik Ekre <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> It was just a suggestion since ECS doesn't seem to be such a well-known
> acronym. Serching for it leads to Esports Championship Series or Amazon
> Elastic Container Service. I mostly wondered if you had thought of
> alternative names. If you want to keep the current one, then that is fine.
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/4556?email_source=notifications&email_token=AFCD32M2KPJHXJGVNH5RDLTQQ3GJPA5CNFSM4JCVRYM2YY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFVREXG43VMVBW63LNMVXHJKTDN5WW2ZLOORPWSZGOECMTA5Y#issuecomment-546910327>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AFCD32OKI2LKUXDAM7BKXETQQ3GJPANCNFSM4JCVRYMQ>
> .
>
I've renamed the package to `Overseer.jl` and also tagged a new release with some other name changes to go with it. Could we merge the v0.1.1 release instead of the v0.1.0?
